page.title: 01THE AREA OF LEE MOOR.
page.content: The Lee Moor area is situated on the edge of Dartmoor,about five miles from Plymouth.The area with which we are concerned is particularly associated with the extraction of china clay.Much of the china clay which is extracted from this area is used as a "filler" for paper,although china clay is used for the manufacture of many other products as well.The village of Lee Moor mainly developed because of the fact that china clay was found there,although these days many of the people who live there are elderly.It is likely that the extraction of china clay will continue here for many years.The highest point in the area is Penn Beacon,from where Plymouth Sound and the surrounding coastline can be seen.
